00141 #include <string.h>
00142 
00143 #include <sys/types.h>
00144 #include <net/ether.h>
00145 #include <net/route.h>
00146 #include <netinet/if_ether.h>
00147 #include <netinet/if_ppp.h>
00148 #include <netinet/ipcsum.h>
00149 #include <netinet/ip.h>
00150 #include <netinet/in.h>
00155 
00182 int NutIpOutput(uint8_t proto, uint32_t dest, NETBUF * nb)
00183 {
00184     uint8_t ha[6];
00185     IPHDR *ip;
00186     NUTDEVICE *dev;
00187     IFNET *nif;
00188     uint32_t gate;
00189     int rc;
00190 
00191     if ((nb = NutNetBufAlloc(nb, NBAF_NETWORK, sizeof(IPHDR))) == 0)
00192         return -1;
00193 
00194     /*
00195      * Set those items in the IP header, which are common for
00196      * all interfaces.
00197      */
00198     ip = nb->nb_nw.vp;
00199     ip->ip_v = 4;
00200     ip->ip_hl = sizeof(IPHDR) / 4;
00201     ip->ip_tos = 0;
00202     ip->ip_len = htons(nb->nb_nw.sz + nb->nb_tp.sz + nb->nb_ap.sz);
00203     ip->ip_off = 0;
00204     if (proto == IPPROTO_IGMP) {
00205         ip->ip_ttl = 1;
00206     } else {
00207         ip->ip_ttl = 0x40;
00208     }
00209     ip->ip_p = proto;
00210     ip->ip_dst = dest;
00211 
00212     /*
00213      * Broadcasts are sent on all network interfaces.
00214      */
00215     if (dest == 0xffffffff) {
00216 
00217         memset(ha, 0xff, sizeof(ha));
00218 
00219         for (dev = nutDeviceList, rc = 0; dev && rc == 0; dev = dev->dev_next) {
00220             if (dev->dev_type == IFTYP_NET) {
00221 
00222                 /*
00223                  * Set remaining IP header items and calculate the checksum.
00224                  */
00225                 nif = dev->dev_icb;
00226                 ip->ip_id = htons(nif->if_pkt_id++);
00227                 ip->ip_src = nif->if_local_ip;
00228                 ip->ip_sum = 0;
00229                 ip->ip_sum = NutIpChkSum(0, nb->nb_nw.vp, nb->nb_nw.sz);
00230                 /*
00231                  * TODO: We must clone the NETBUF!!!
00232                  */
00233                 if (nif->if_type == IFT_ETHER)
00234                     rc = (*nif->if_output) (dev, ETHERTYPE_IP, ha, nb);
00235                 else
00236                     rc = (*nif->if_output) (dev, PPP_IP, 0, nb);
00237             }
00238         }
00239         return rc;
00240     }
00241 
00242     /*
00243      * Get destination's route. This will also return the proper 
00244      * interface.
00245      */
00246     if ((dev = NutIpRouteQuery(dest, &gate)) == 0) {
00247         NutNetBufFree(nb);
00248         return -1;
00249     }
00250 
00251     /*
00252      * Set remaining IP header items and calculate the checksum.
00253      */
00254     nif = dev->dev_icb;
00255     ip->ip_id = htons(nif->if_pkt_id++);
00256     ip->ip_src = nif->if_local_ip;
00257     ip->ip_sum = 0;
00258     ip->ip_sum = NutIpChkSum(0, nb->nb_nw.vp, nb->nb_nw.sz);
00259 
00260     /*
00261      * On Ethernet we query the MAC address of our next hop,
00262      * which might be the destination or the gateway to this
00263      * destination.
00264      */
00265     if (nif->if_type == IFT_ETHER) {
00266         /* 
00267          * Detect directed broadcasts for the local network. In this
00268          * case don't send ARP queries, but send directly to MAC broadcast
00269          * address. 
00270          */
00271         if ((gate == 0) && ((dest | nif->if_mask) == 0xffffffff)) {
00272             memset(ha, 0xff, sizeof(ha));
00273         } else if (NutArpCacheQuery(dev, gate ? gate : dest, ha)) {
00274             /* Note, that a failed ARP request is not considered a 
00275                transmission error. It might be caused by a simple 
00276                packet loss. */
00277             return 0;
00278         }
00279         return (*nif->if_output) (dev, ETHERTYPE_IP, ha, nb);
00280     } else if (nif->if_type == IFT_PPP)
00281         return (*nif->if_output) (dev, PPP_IP, 0, nb);
00282 
00283     NutNetBufFree(nb);
00284     return -1;
00285 }
